Problem:
Consider a quadratic functional integral equation system governed by \\(I(x) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty e^{-x^2 + xt} dt\\). We examine the effects of applying the Fourier transform, defined as \\(\\mathcal{F}(I)(k) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty I(x) e^{-ikx} dx\\).

Suppose an additional transformation, the Laplace transform \\(\\mathcal{L}(I)(s) = \\int_{0}^\\infty I(x) e^{-sx} dx\\), is applied at a certain time. Will the resultant function depend only on the analytical properties of I(x) and not on the Fourier transform?
Explanation: While I(x) directly influences both transforms, the application of the Laplace transform after the Fourier transform could suggest dependencies or comparative analysis between the two transformations' results. Consequently, the resultant functions' analytical properties may reflect combined or comparative influences of these transformations.
